comments:
We have just released a major eFix for WSAD that upgrades the workbench to 
2.0.3. The v1.0.1 Core Tools patch causes a 2.0.3 workbench to not start. Could 
we please get an update because we would like to continue to run the 
performance tools.  

Here is a snippet from the log

!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: 
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.DelegatingURLClassLoader: field MONITOR_PLUGINS 
not found
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.doPluginActivation
(PluginDescriptor.java:192)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginClassLoader.activatePlugin
(PluginClassLoader.java:59)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginClassLoader.internalFindClassParentsSelf
(PluginClassLoader.java:137)

Are you using Core Tools Patch v1.0.1?  This patch is required for running the
core performance tools on 2.0.* builds.  It's available here:

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-core-home/downloads/tools/core-tools-patch_1.0.1.zip

You asked: Are you using Core Tools Patch v1.0.1?  It is this patch that is the 
problem. With this patch applied our workbenches won't start.

I assume that without the patch we won't be able to use the core performance 
tools.

What errors do you get in the metadata log file when your workbenches don't 
start?

Sorry, what I meant to ask was is the log that you include with or without the 
1.0.1 patch for the resources plug-in.
Note that I installed 2.0.3 + patches + tools and it started ok.

The log snippet that I included in the description, is from the GM version of 
WSAD + 1.0.1 patch + eFix for WSAD.

Perhaps the eFix for WSAD isn't exactly eclipse 2.0.3, I'm not sure. Update 
Manager reports it as Eclipse Platform SDK 2.0.3

Closing. We are unable to reproduce this at our end, they work ok for 2.1.3, and
Jeff has modified the Eclipse tools to work in the 3.0 stream.
